Agent.Comment:
SILVER CONVERSATION
Mouse is not what he seems.
Mouse initially presents as an apprentice who failed the same test the player is undergoing. He seems to have lost part of himself, and while he claims that the way home for him is complicated, he may be able to help the player. He is eager, almost too much so, and reinforces that the masters who sent them to the test are unfair. He seems to have forgotten part of himself, so his answers are not always specific. This is all a lie.
Mouse is a demon in disguise. The demon that he helps the player fight is not the real threat. Mouse uses the defeat of the decoy to gain the playerâ€™s trust, and then try to kill him. Mouse is a demon of Pride, inflating his victim's ego by needing to be saved. His true form is not revealed until the end.

Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.Comment: IF: the Demon has been defeated, Mouse did not switch sides

Agent.text: You did it. You actually did it!
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Impressed.

Agent.text: When you came, I hoped that maybe you might be able to... but I never really thought any of you were worthy.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: impressed

Agent.text: That is because you are a true mage, one of the few.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Encouraging, deflecting doubt.

Agent.text: What? They were not as promising as you. It was a long time ago.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Caught off guard. He thought he was in control of the situation, but the player is looking defiant.

Agent.text: I... I don't remember their names.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Matter of fact

Agent.text: I don't even remember my own name. It's the Fade, and the templars killing me, like they tried with you.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Switching gears, trying to obviously curry sympathy

Agent.text: You made me believe in you. You're a true mage, one of the few.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: sad, bitter -- he hates himself

Agent.text: The others, they never had a chance. The templars set them up to fail, like they tried with you.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: trying to frame his betrayal of others as a regretful necessity.
Agent.EditorComment: added comma

Agent.text: I regret my part in it, but you have shown me that there is hope. You can be so much more than you know.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Switching gears, trying to obviously curry sympathy

Agent.text: I am what the Fade has made me. Am I to blame for that? Deciding to exist or not exist is not a fair choice.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: rationalizing, trying to inspire sympathy

Agent.text: I had no hope. You have shown me other possibilities. If you want to help.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human

Agent.text: You defeated a demon, you completed your test. With time, you will be a master enchanter with no equal.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Encouraging, appealling for help

Agent.text: And maybe there's hope in that for someone as small and as... forgotten as me. If you want to help.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Looking sympathetic, floating his plan and seeing if the player will bite.

Agent.text: There may be a way for me to leave here, to get a foothold outside. You just need to want to let me in.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Appealing, carefully.

Agent.text: What? What are you... Of course it was! What else is here that could harm an apprentice of your potential?
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Trying to reassure, but turning to disgust as he realizes that the player has seen through his lies.
Agent.EditorComment: Capitalized "Of," fixed ellipses, added question mark

Agent.text: You are a smart one.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Cold. the jig is up.
Agent.EditorComment: added "a"

Agent.text: Back! Help me back. They killed me, right? Just like all who fail in here. They'll kill you too.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Recovering after saying a little too much, agitated, trying to remind the player of supposed danger.

Agent.text: No, no, **no**! It must be your choice. Quickly now, the templars are going to kill you.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Agitated, getting impatient, trying to remind the player of supposed danger.

Agent.text: Can't you feel the sword at your neck? They believe all magic evil, the Fade evil. Once you are here, you become what they fear.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Agitated, getting impatient, trying to remind the player of supposed danger.

Agent.text: They know nothing! Dipping children in the Fade to tease, repeating "Maker" like it means something. I hate those mortals so much!
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Growing rage. Forgets to check himself, let's "mortals" slip out.

Agent.text: I mean, we're all mortal, but the templars...
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: realizes he said to much, halfhearted attempt to bluff, then quits.
Agent.EditorComment: removed fourth dot

Agent.text: What? Yes! Of course! I mean, I think I was. Isn't that enough? It should be enough! For you.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Trying to reassure, but turning to disgust as he realizes that the player has seen through his lies.

Agent.text: Maybe they are right about you.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Cold. the jig is up.

Agent.text: Simple killing is a warrior's job. The real dangers of the fade are preconceptions, careless trust... pride.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.Comment: FOLEY: Mouse transforms into pride demon.
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Smiling. Explaining, getting a little staccato as he stands straighter. Linger on "pride" like it means everything. Mouse is actually a "Pride Demon"

Agent.Comment:
Action: Mouse transforms into a Pride Demon. DO NOT show a clear view with details. Heavy effects and maybe a camera shot over the demon's shoulder to the player to suggest size and height without revealing much more than the back of his head.
Point of contact: Luke, Mike

Agent.text: Keep your wits about you, mage. True tests **never** end.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.Comment: FOLEY: Needs 'fade' effect on voice for this line. Character is speaking from the great beyond.
Agent.VoiceOverComment: A lingering farewell. Malevolent, confident. He's been outfoxed, but he'll win in the end. Bigger, he looks like a demon now, not Mouse.
Agent.EditorComment: added "end"

Agent.text: Another spirit this way. It never seemed equal to its name, to me.
Agent.Comment: IF: player crosses the trigger leading to Valor
Agent.VoiceOverComment: critical. The spirit is "Valor". Mouse is unimpressed with it.
Agent.EditorComment:
Changed "to equal its" to "equal to its"
Formerly: One of the spirits I mentioned is down this path, I think.

Agent.text: Be cautious. There is... another spirit, here. Not the one hunting you, but still...
Agent.Comment: IF: player crosses the trigger leading to Sloth
Agent.VoiceOverComment: frightened
Agent.EditorComment: removed fourth period

Agent.text: And there is a spirit of rage.
Agent.Comment: IF: near the demon, once it is spawned into the area
Agent.VoiceOverComment: resolute warning, nervous for the player

Agent.text: That is where the test will take place. The creature can be anywhere, but it manifests there.
Agent.Comment:
IF: near the demon's area, before it is spawned
SET: BHM_MOUSE_DEMON_SITE_SEEN
Agent.VoiceOverComment: said with a hushed voice, looking around, trying to instill a little paranoia

Agent.text: A dangerous spirit is not far. Don't go near it unless you're ready to fight.
Agent.Comment: IF: shout after joining the party
Agent.VoiceOverComment: nervous for the player, warning.

Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.Comment: IF: Mouse is in the party

Agent.text: I've never felt this way before. It's... strange.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.Comment: IF: Mouse is a bear
Agent.VoiceOverComment: he's not sure whether it's good-strange or bad-strange

Agent.text: It is dangerous to be out in the open like this. Not that hiding helps much in the Fade.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: a bit angry at the player for making him be so vulnerable

Agent.text: Oh, it's no trouble. I've... helped a few other people. I can help you.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: evasive -- he's not telling the player that he plans to betray him, he wants the player to think he's being helpful

Agent.text: It's... difficult to just hide when another apprentice is in the Fade.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Trying to make it seem like he's very concerned for the player.

Agent.text: I missed my chance, so I became small. Unnoticeable. I hide from the bigger things, learn from the smaller things.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Thinking to a faraway place.

Agent.text: There are places you can hide where the shadows go on forever. You stay there long enough, and the shadows begin to creep inside of you.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: haunted -- he is a creature of the darkness, hiding it from the player.
Agent.EditorComment: added comma

Agent.text: I... don't know how long it's been. Forever, maybe.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: snapping out of it.

Agent.text: That is what happens to the physical bodies of apprentices who fail. They'd kill every mage if they could. All the templars see in magic is danger.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: bitter at "them" -- people who fear and hate mages, such as the templars. He gets a bit short with the player here for not already knowing this.
Agent.EditorComment: What's so hard to believe? They'd kill us all, if they could. We're a danger. That's all they'll ever see us as.

Agent.text: And they don't just use the Harrowing. If you learn a little too much, they'll label you a blood mage and kill you on sight!
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.Comment: SET: BHM_MOUSE_MENTIONED_BLOOD_MAGE
Agent.VoiceOverComment: CAreful accusation, trying to build likeminded sentiment in the player.
Agent.EditorComment: They thought I was a blood mage. I know that, now. I think that's why they didn't give me more time.

Agent.text: True mages like you know that the power you hold is a gateway to greater things. A potential they can never hope to contain!
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: rising focus and anger -- his cheerleading is getting a little personal and he's getting caught up in it.
Agent.EditorComment: Ha! I wish I had been. I would have showed them all! I would have taught them a lesson!

Agent.text: Be turned into an emotionless freak? That is what it is, you know. To never dream, never feel.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: incredulous, the Rite of Tranquility is essentially lobotomization.

Agent.text: Even demons abhor them, but I suppose that is the trade-off. They can't be possessed. As if that is worse than losing yourself.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: scoffing at the idea
Agent.EditorComment:
trade > trade-off
Formerly: To never dream, never feel... and never be taken over by a demon. Some trade!

Agent.text: No. It's not. The templars and the Chantry and all of it, they're all paranoid. The lot of them.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: bitter and angry

Agent.text: They have no right to treat true mages this way! You could stand up to them! If they gave you the chance.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: encouraging the player to think this way, to guide his anger and suspicion elsewhere.
Agent.EditorComment: give > gave

Agent.text: Am I? I'm sorry.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: his anger suddenly deflates --he reigns it in, realizing he's gone a bit too far

Agent.text: There are people who don't go to the Circle of Magi, you know. Who don't obey the templars. They are hunted, but at least they're free.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Sliding in thoughts of rebellion. Cultivating distrust in the player.

Agent.text: You don't want to lose yourself here. Being nothing would be easier than this.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Planting suspicion, but hiding under a guise of self-pity
Agent.EditorComment: I came here and I lost everything I was. Being nothing would be easier. Being dead would be easier.

Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: hesitating -- the idea of dying scares him too much

Agent.text: Think you should finish your Harrowing.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: rather than answering the question he deflects it. "I don't want to talk about this any more."

Agent.text: I should have done a lot of things.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: regret, a bit angry at the player too for rubbing his nose in it

Agent.text: You'll find out for yourself, soon enough. Maybe you'll say the same thing to yourself, one day.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: bitter and a bit angry, "maybe what happened to me will happen to you too"
Agent.EditorComment: added second comma

Agent.text: Yes. Horrible.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: flat

Agent.text: Out of here? Out of the Fade?
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: interest, but careful not to appear eager

Agent.text: I don't know. I don't have a body waiting for me. It's not something I try to think about.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Playing the victim a bit, fishing for sympathy without looking weak.

Agent.text: Stay here too long, and it's like being adrift. Pieces of you float away... until you're not even a memory.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: quiet horror
Agent.EditorComment: added comma, its > it's

Agent.text: I don't know. Maybe what comes next is worse.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: quiet, reflective. Planting doubt.

Agent.text: Brave words.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: bitter -- he thinks the player is a fool

Agent.text: I have no example to compare myself against. Only people like you, taking the Harrowing.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: lonely -- there should be regret in his voice, as well. The other people taking the Harrowing that he's met he has betrayed
Agent.EditorComment: I don't know. I've never met anybody like me here before. Only people like you, people taking the Harrowing.

Agent.text: Mages, real ones that come here... they ignore me. They think I'm a spirit pretending to be me.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: bristling with hate for these mages

Agent.text: I don't want to talk about it any more. Let's just... get you out of here.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: bitter, doesn't want to keep talking because he might say something he'll regret

Agent.text: Because they're sadistic bastards, that's why. And I'm not talking about demons.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: encouraging anger at "them" -- the people who sent the player into the Fade

Agent.text: Everyone must face the Harrowing because there's a small chance a mage **might** become possessed and become an abomination.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: furious, bitter, encouraging distrust

Agent.text: Thrown to the mercy of a demon when you're at your weakest. "For the safety of all."
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: furious, bitter -- "for the safety of all" a church catchphrase said here with acid

Agent.text: But how many mages have met their fate in tests like this over the centuries? Don't those lives matter as well?
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Reasoning hard. Trying to steer the player to distrust his masters.
Agent.EditorComment: We wouldn't have all died this way! Don't our murders count for anything?

Agent.text: They aren't, but power attracts attention. Maybe it's entering the Fade awake. Not a gentle process.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: he says this sarcastically, as this is the reasoning that others use (but he disagrees is sufficient cause)

Agent.text: I don't really know. Magic is evil, and therefore, so are you. They'll never change.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: his anger fades here -- "Magic is evil, and so are we" should be said bitter. Encouraging doubt

Agent.text: They don't want you prepared. If you can resist it when forced like this, you can do it any time.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: scoffing at the idea, furious -- "If you can resist it" line is not what HE thinks but rather the reason they don't want you prepared.

Agent.text: It's either that, or they turn you into a freak, a Tranquil who can't be possessed, but who also can't feel anything, ever.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: bitter, angry; Tranquil = lobotomization
Agent.EditorComment: added first and second-last and last commas; deleted "at all" before "but"

Agent.text: The Circle is a prison. You have choices... between joining and suffering various deaths of body or spirit. Remember that.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: bitter, sad
Agent.EditorComment: The Circle is a prison. You have a choice between joining and various deaths of body or spirit. Remember that.

Agent.text: There are many creatures in the Fade. Some all fire and rage, some less so.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: he's lying -- the demon is his decoy
Agent.EditorComment: I don't really know that much about it.

Agent.text: I... don't remember.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: he's lying -- he's betrayed the other apprentices who tried

Agent.text: It's been a long time since I saw anyone else. I think there were others like you before, but... when?
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: he's half-lying -- his memories of those who came before are indeed fading

Agent.text: I don't think everyone who takes the Harrowing comes here, to this place in the Fade. Or maybe they do, and I've forgotten.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: sad -- looking sympathetic
Agent.EditorComment: added last comma

Agent.text: You fight it, I think. You kill it.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: he knows this is harder than it sounds

Agent.text: Think of it this way: Everything here is a matter of will, right? I'm not really a mouse, just like you're not really standing there in that body.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: trying to explain something difficult, thinking on his feet
Agent.EditorComment: capitalized Everything

Agent.text: You fight the creature, you're resisting it. If it wins, it defeats you and possesses you.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: trying to explain something difficult, thinking on his feet

Agent.text: Then you die. Not from the demon, oh no... The templars will take care of that.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: bitter and angry -- not at the demon, but at the templars.

Agent.text: I'm... sorry. I suppose it's not very helpful to say that.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: redirecting, suggesting the player will end up like that.

Agent.text: Oh? Well good for you. Nothing to worry about, then.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: sarcastic

Agent.text: I... guess the reverse is also potentially true. That's a very complicated thing to consider. I'd stick with killing it.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: The player is picking it up too quickly. He doesn't want the player to get too smart.

Agent.text: We already passed the place where I saw it last. It will probably come back there later, if it doesn't find you first.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: "if it doesn't find you first" -- darkly, because that would be a BAD thing

Agent.text: There's an area not far ahead where I saw it last. I don't know if it's still there or not.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: he's frightened of the demon

Agent.text: It's the realm of dreams. You know that, don't you?
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: he thinks the player should know it

Agent.text: Everyone comes here to dream, but it is fleeting, and they remember little. But mages can enter awake, and that draws attention.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: patient explanation
Agent.EditorComment: gets > draws

Agent.text: There are many spirits in the Fade. These... demons feed on the dark parts of the mind. The templars in the tower would give them a meal for certain.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Thinking far away. "Templar" said with hate. He thinks templars are evil and thus demons would have a lot to feed on
Agent.EditorComment: The Fade is where all the demons are, however. They feed on the darker parts of the mind, I think. If they ever got ahold of a templar, they'd have a field day!

Agent.text: Normally there are doorways out, portals, but I think the mages have sealed them. I don't know how long that lasts.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: when he mentions the mages it's with hate

Agent.text: Until you complete your Harrowing, I imagine.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: shrugging

Agent.text: Maybe. If you're able to forget that you're you. That takes a long time.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: dubious

Agent.text: You can't think like a spirit. They shape the Fade according to their will. Solid things, real things, are just more complicated ideas.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: trying to explain

Agent.text: I think you'd better focus on something simpler. Defeat your spirit or demon. Or be killed.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: his advice -- he thinks the "or be killed" is much more likely

Agent.text: Er... directions are tough, here. If you look around, I'll tell you if we're getting close. How about that?
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Not really wanting him to find help, but hiding it.
Agent.EditorComment: Err > Er

Agent.text: I'm ready, if you are.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.Comment: IF: Mouse is a bear
Agent.VoiceOverComment: determined

Agent.text: That staff will help. Maybe.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.Comment: IF: the player has Valor's staff
Agent.VoiceOverComment: uncertain

Agent.text: You should probably find some help before charging after the demon. Might be wise.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: uncertain -- he really doesn't think ANY help is possible

Agent.text: Someone else thrown to the wolves. As fresh and unprepared as ever.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse
Agent.VoiceOverComment: contemptuous -- not of the player but rather of those who throw people to wolves

Agent.text: It isn't right that they do this, the templars. Not to you, me, anyone.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse
Agent.VoiceOverComment: angry, bitter, but also encouraging the player to think the same

Agent.text: You think you're really here? In that body? You look like that because you **think** you do!
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse
Agent.Comment: SET: BHM_MOUSE_MENTIONS_SHAPECHANGE
Agent.VoiceOverComment: a bit impatient that the player doesn't get it

Agent.text: But they keep doing it, don't they? We get treated like rabid dogs, and we let them get away with it!
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse
Agent.VoiceOverComment: angry, bitter, but also encouraging the player to think the same

Agent.text: You say that now. So have many others before you. Look at me, look at what can happen.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse
Agent.VoiceOverComment: angry, bitter, but also encouraging the player to think the same

Agent.text: *Sigh* It's always the same. But it's not your fault. You're in the same boat I was, aren't you?
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse
Agent.Comment:
FOLEY: Mouse starts transformation (2 parts. See previous line.)
Auto screenshot
Agent.VoiceOverComment: he's not really responding to the player's question at all -- he's just sort of sighing sadly and remarking on the fact that here is yet one more victim of the Harrowing

Agent.text: Allow me to welcome you to the Fade. You can call me... well, Mouse.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.Comment: FOLEY: Mouse finishes transformation. (2 parts. See previous line.)
Agent.VoiceOverComment: a proper introduction -- the hesitation on the "you can call me" is because Mouse isn't his real name. He doesn't remember his real name.

Agent.text: No. I don't remember anything from... before.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: "before" meaning "before I died" which he is hesitant to discuss

Agent.text: It's fuzzy, that time before. They wake you up in the middle of the night and drag you to the Harrowing chamber and then...
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: said with seething anger; "before" meaning "before I died".
Agent.EditorComment: "..." is end punctuation in DA style, so removed extra dot from "...."

Agent.text: Like I said, in this place, you are what you perceive yourself to be. I think I used to be like you... before.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.Comment: IF: BHM_MOUSE_MENTIONS_SHAPECHANGE
Agent.VoiceOverComment: a bit sullen; "before" meaning "before I died".

Agent.text: This place isn't real like you understand it. Here, you are what you perceive. I think I used to be like you... before.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: a bit sullen; "before" meaning "before I died".

Agent.text: The templars kill you if you take too long, you see. They figure you failed, and they don't want something getting out.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Focused for a moment. Wants the threat of what could happen to be very clear.

Agent.text: That's what they did to me, I think. I have no body to reclaim. And you don't have much time before you end up the same.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Trying to solicite sympathy, and make the player not want it to happen to them.

Agent.text: I... I don't remember. I ran away and I hid. I don't know how long.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: quiet voice, regretful -- his memories have become fuzzy
Agent.EditorComment: removed "Too long." from end of line (confusing, sounds like an answer to the question, even though Mouse is saying you have *little* time)

Agent.text: That has been said before. But you don't know the danger.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: a bit annoyed at the player's bravado
Agent.EditorComment: Then I guess you should know what you're up against.

Agent.text: Don't waste time with that talk. You don't want to end up like... this.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: angry, sad -- he hates himself, but he's also using it to spur the player on.

Agent.text: There's something here, contained, just for an apprentice like you. You have to face the creature, a demon, and resist it, if you can.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: says "contained" with some contempt. He's secretly referring to himself.
Agent.EditorComment: There's a demon here. The mages came again and they closed off all the doorways out, so you can't get away.

Agent.text: That's your way out. Or your opponent's, if the templars wouldn't kill you. A test for you, a tease for the creatures of the Fade.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: The player should think he is contemptuous of the 'test', but he is equally hateful of the 'tease'. "It's a way out for you, or for the creature that defeats you if the templars played fair."
Agent.EditorComment: Either you find it or it finds you. But that's it. That's the Harrowing.

Agent.text: A question for those in the tower. Maybe you'll be lucky enough to ask. Maybe someday, so will I.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.EditorComment: added comma

Agent.text: You would be a fool to just attack everything you see. What you face is powerful, cunning.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: being cautious -- he's frightened of the demon

Agent.text: There are others here, other spirits. They will tell you more, maybe help. If you can believe anything you see.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: hesitates when he suggests this -- if he says nothing, the player will know he's not helping, but he doesn't really want the player stronger.
Agent.EditorComment: There are others here, other spirits. Maybe you could ask them for assistance.

Agent.text: I'll follow, if that's all right. My chance was long ago, but you... you may have a way out.
Agent.Speaker: bhm600cr_mouse_human
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Sounds like he wants to help the player get out. Secretly wants the player to be HIS way out.
Agent.EditorComment: I'll even come with you. My magic is gone, but I might be able to help a little.

Agent.text: It's all a little too easy.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: The ones you betrayed before me. What were their names?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.VoiceOverComment: Accusatory tone on the question.

Agent.text: Sounds like your help was unusual. Why?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: So what is it that you think you can get from me?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Anything to survive. Like an animal. Or worse.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: I understand necessity. What now?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.EditorComment: In > I

Agent.text: I'm starting to think the other demon wasn't my test.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Let you in?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: I'll find mages away from the templars. We'll get you out.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Not my problem, Mouse.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Maybe they are right about some things.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Like you. Were you ever really an apprentice?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: There's no need to follow me.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: How have you survived here so long?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.Comment: SET: BHM_MOUSE_TALK_1

Agent.text: The templars simply killed you?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.Comment:
IF: BHM_MOUSE_TALK_1
Set BHM_MOUSE_TALK_2

Agent.text: Isn't there also the option of the Rite of Tranquility?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.EditorComment: Do you wish you'd taken the Rite of Tranquility, instead? You could have taken the Rite of Tranquility instead.

Agent.text: It's not right, how they control us.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.EditorComment: added comma

Agent.text: You're getting a little crazy, Mouse.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Do you... want to die?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: You should have fought harder.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: That's horrible.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Is there no way I can help you get out of here?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.Comment: IF: BHM_MOUSE_TALK_1

Agent.text: Would you prefer to die?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: That won't happen to me.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Are you certain?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Why make us face a spirit or demon for the Harrowing?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.Comment: SET: BHM_MOUSE_TALK_DEMON
Agent.EditorComment: Why is the Harrowing like this? Why Why a spirit or deamon or whetever. Why fight a demon? I don't get it.

Agent.text: They teach that abominations are extremely dangerous.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Mages can't be the only ones at risk of possession.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.EditorComment: But mages aren't the only ones who get possessed! You'd think we'd be safer.

Agent.text: Why don't they prepare us better for this fight?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.EditorComment: more > better

Agent.text: Tell me more about the creature I must face.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.Comment: IF: BHM_MOUSE_TALK_DEMON
Agent.EditorComment: have to > must

Agent.text: Have you seen anyone defeat a demon before?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: How does one resist being possessed?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: And what happens then?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.EditorComment: Combat here is a literal battle of wills.

Agent.text: It won't win. Trust me.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Combat is a battle of wills, so will itself is combat?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.EditorComment: Combat is a battle of wills, so will itself is combat?

Agent.text: Where do I find the demon?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: What do you know about the Fade?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: How do I get out of here?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Is it possible to change, like you do?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Where are these other spirits you mentioned?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Let's keep moving.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: Is... this the Fade?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: You're a talking rat.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: No, it isn't right at all.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: I will succeed, right or not.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
PLAYER
Agent.Comment: ACTION: he turns into human form

Agent.text: Not your real name, I take it?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: You took the Harrowing?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: You can change your shape?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: What am I supposed to do?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: How long do I have, exactly?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER

Agent.text: That's not going to happen to me.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.Comment: SET: BHM_MOUSE_APPROVAL_MINUS_ONE

Agent.text: I'm sorry for what happened.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.Comment: SET: BHM_MOUSE_APPROVAL_PLUS_ONE
Agent.EditorComment: Was "I'm so sorry." (Doesn't make sense in link above)

Agent.text: Anything can die. I doubt it's as simple as that.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.EditorComment: So I need to defeat this demon.

Agent.text: Why pit me against such a creature?
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.EditorComment: That's crazy! I can't kill a demon! I've never even seen a demon.

Agent.text: I don't understand why this test is so feared.
Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.EditorComment: Sounds simple enough.

Agent.Speaker: PLAYER
Agent.Comment: ACTION: Mouse joins the party
